metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2905 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
fish (aka fish-shell) 1.16.0 before 2.1.1 does not properly check the credentials, which allows local users to gain privileges via the universal variable socket, related to /tmp/fishd.socket.user permissions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fish - 2.1.1-1
fish-common - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fish package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
